thread.title: Tottenham proved Chelsea are far from invincible - now Antonio Conte faces real test to keep them on title trail
thread.title_full: Tottenham proved Chelsea are far from invincible - now Antonio Conte faces real test to keep them on title trail

author: John Cross
title: Tottenham proved Chelsea are far from invincible - now Antonio Conte faces real test to keep them on title trail
text:
Chelsea's players trudge back to the centre circle (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Now comes the real test for Antonio Conte. 
The remarkable 13 game winning run ended without much of a fight as Chelsea were outclassed and outfought by Tottenham. 
Conte’s men missed the chance to make Premier League history with a record breaking 14th win but that pales into insignificance compared to the ramifications of the defeat. 
Suddenly, the title race is open again as rather than be eight clear, Chelsea are now just five points ahead of Liverpool in second place. 
Liverpool, Manchester City, Arsenal and Manchester United have got hope again. Chelsea are no longer so far away in the distance. Conte gestures on the touchline (Photo: Chelsea Football Club) Chelsea's Cesar Azpilicueta and David Luiz look dejected (Photo: REUTERS) 
Perhaps most worrying of all, Tottenham have got momentum after five wins in a row and they also showed that Chelsea are far from invincible. They are no longer in cruise control and it’s a test of their mental strength. 
Even Conte looked subdued during the game at White Hart Lane, his touchline histrionics were more low key than usual. 
There was less screaming and shouting, less drama and at the end he simply embraced Mauricio Pochettino, a moment of respect having been beaten at last. Tottenham's Dele Alli scores their first goal (Photo: Reuters) Alli heads in his second (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur FC/Getty Images) 
But they must quickly rediscover their best form, their winning formula as next up they face Leicester, Hull, Liverpool and Arsenal as their next four Premier League games. 
In truth, even though Chelsea have been winning, their level of performance has just dropped slightly in recent games, even pushed hard by Stoke on New Year’s Day. 
Even having an extra 24 hours’ rest than Tottenham and perhaps the most forgiving festive programme of all the title contenders, did not help. Tottenham's players celebrate (Photo: Chelsea Football Club) 
Chelsea looked a bit flat, especially going forward. Moussa Dembele won the midfield battle with N’Golo Kante and Eden Hazard missed Chelsea’s best two chances. 
There was even some comedy gold with Diego Costa’s spat with Pedro after a misplaced through ball sparked a row between the pair in the first half. Diego Costa remonstrates with Pedro (Photo: Reuters) Chelsea manager Antonio Conte looks dejected (Photo: REUTERS) 
It was, after all, their first defeat in 14 games so it’s hardly a crisis. But when that sort of run is finally ended, it’s vital to win the next one and make sure a blip doesn't turn into anything more worrying. 
Conte has been superb at whipping up his players when the going has been good. But now is where he will face a test to keep Chelsea firmly on the title trail. poll loading Will Chelsea win the title this season? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
